title.narrative: KH IDEA - informal worker w/ disability

description.narrative: This project aims to strengthening influencing capacity of informal workers who are living with disability to have their voice heard and respond as stated in the law on protection and promotion of the rights of persons with disabilities. It is intend to empower 50 existing members of IDEA who are informal workers and also living with disability to be able to demand their rights to participatein social inclusive development through capacity building, awareness raising, collective action like join statement with other NGOsnetwork for a stronger voice. This project will also strengthening capacity and knowledge of IDEA#s staff on disability and accessibility at workplace while they can use as a tools to advocate with employer or business sector to have better working condition for people with disability. The project allow members with disability to have a safe space to meet, share, learn and support each other to understand the power of solidarity to demand for their rights protection by the government. This 12 months project is target to implement in Phnom Penh where majority of informal worker including Tuk Tuk drivers, domestic workers, street vendors, and garbage collectors are migrated to settle.

participating-org.narrative: Independent Democracy of Informal economy association

Independent Democratic informal Economy Association (IDEA) was established in 2005 by group of the informal economy workers. IDEA is a member based organization with over 10,000 members fromTukTuk, Moto-taxi drivers, street vendors, small restaurant workers, domestic workers and load carriers.All these groups form together a national association; the secretariat coordinates, expands and supports the membership and defends their rights towards concerned stakeholders. The group is very active in social dialogue with their members, the authorities (municipality, police,company etc.) in order to create awareness and to find join solution to the abuse to their members. They are very active on bringing the issue of informal sector on the labor broad agenda, including the social securityright.The association has currently branches in 5 provinces (Phnom Penh, BanteayMeanchey, Battambang, Kampong Som and Siem Reap).

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
